knimeNode.name: k-Means
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a crisp center based clustering.

fullDescription.intro:
This node outputs the cluster centers for a predefined number of clusters (no dynamic number of clusters). K-means performs a crisp clustering that assigns a data vector to exactly one cluster. The algorithm terminates when the cluster assignments do not change anymore.
The clustering algorithm uses the Euclidean distance on the selected attributes. The data is not normalized by the node (if required, you should consider to use the "Normalizer" as a preprocessing step).
fullDescription.option: The number of clusters (cluster centers) to be created.

Allows to pick the centroid initialization method. First k rows initializes the centroids using the first rows of the input table. Random initialization initializes the centroids with random rows of the input table. When picking the Random initialization , by checking the Use static random seed it is possible to get reproducible results (same centroids for the same seed). The static random seed value can be controlled by manipulating the corresponding flow variable named: centroid_seeds
Note: The choice between the centroid initialization methods can be controlled by a flow variable as well, named: centroid_initialization . The default option: Random initialization will be picked if a string "RANDOM_INITIALIZATION" is fed to this variable, while for First k rows option the flow variable needs to be set "FIRST_ROWS".
The number of iterations after which the algorithm terminates, independent of the accuracy improvement of the cluster centers.
Move the numeric columns of interest to the "Include" list. Always include all columns option moves all numeric columns to the "Include" list by default.

If enabled, the hiliting of a cluster row (2nd output) will hilite all rows of this cluster in the input table and the 1st output table. Depending on the number of rows, enabling this feature might consume a lot of memory.

ports.inPort: Input to clustering. All numerical values and only these are considered for clustering.
ports.outPort: The input data labeled with the cluster they are contained in.

views.view: Displays the cluster prototypes in a tree-like structure, with each node containing the coordinates of the cluster center.
